0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Excessive upper gastrointestinal gas: 40 to 360 mg ORALLY 4 times daily after meals and at bedtime as needed; MAX 500 mg/day
  • Ultrasonography; Adjunct: 400 mL (7.5 mg/mL) ORALLY over 15 minutes; fast at least 4 hours before taking the suspension

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• Excessive upper gastrointestinal gas: (under 2 yrs) 20 mg ORALLY 4 times daily after meals and at bedtime; MAX 12 doses/day (240 mg/day)
  • Excessive upper gastrointestinal gas: (2-12 yrs) 40 mg ORALLY 4 times daily after meals and at bedtime; MAX 12 doses/day (240 mg/day)

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Excessive upper gastrointestinal gas
  • Ultrasonography; Adjunct
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
  • Colonoscopy - Preparation of bowel for procedure
  • Radionuclide study of lung; Adjunct

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• hypersensitivity to simethicone products
  • known or suspected intestinal perforation and obstruction

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Oral-Local: Acts in vitro to lower the surface tension of gas bubbles. Its relevance to action in vivo is not clearly established.

sub.title: Clinical Effects
sub.mono:
SILICONES
USES: Silicone is used to make consumer products and medical implants. It is used as a filler in breast implants. It has been injected directly into tissue for cosmetic purposes, although this is not a medically approved use. Simethicone is used to treat colic and gaseous distension. PHARMACOLOGY: Simethicone is though to decrease gaseous distension by decreasing surface tension of gas bubbles in the GI tract. TOXICOLOGY: Silicones are generally not toxic, but injection may result in local granuloma formation. Systemic absorption of a large amount may produce silicone pulmonary embolism. EPIDEMIOLOGY: Environmental exposure is common. Injection for cosmetic purposes is uncommon. Life-threatening effects are very rare. MILD TO MODERATE TOXICITY: Ingestion is not expected to produce significant toxicity. Injection may produce local tissue granuloma formation. SEVERE TOXICITY: Direct injection into tissue can cause a severe systemic reaction with fever, pneumonitis, widespread microemboli and associated tissue infarction (primarily lungs but also intestines, liver, brain and heart), acute lung injury, and alveolar hemorrhage. Fatalities have been reported.

sub.title: Treatment
sub.mono:
SILICONES
  • Support: MANAGEMENT OF MILD TO MODERATE TOXICITY: Minimal symptoms are expected and no specific care is required. MANAGEMENT OF SEVERE TOXICITY: Patients with symptoms of pulmonary embolism may require ventilator support for hypoxia.
  • Decontamination: Decontamination is not indicated. Surgical excision may be considered for severe tissue reactions to injected silicone.
  • Antidote: None.
  • Monitoring of patient: Routine laboratory studies are generally not needed. Obtain chest radiographs in patients with pulmonary symptoms.
  • Enhanced elimination procedure: There is no role for enhanced elimination.
  • Patient disposition: HOME CRITERIA: If patients are symptomatic following an acute unintentional ingestion they can be followed at home. OBSERVATION CRITERIA: Patients who are symptomatic, patients who have injected silicone, and those with deliberate ingestions, should be referred to a healthcare facility. ADMISSION CRITERIA: Patients who remain persistently symptomatic should be admitted and monitored for worsening respiratory symptoms. CONSULT CRITERIA: Consult a poison center or medical toxicologist for assistance in managing respiratory symptoms.

sub.title: Range of Toxicity
sub.mono:
SILICONES
TOXIC DOSE: Ingestion does not cause systemic toxicity, although packets may cause foreign body effects. Most cases of severe toxicity are associated with injection of large volumes of silicone oil.

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• This drug may cause diarrhea, nausea, or vomiting.
  • Advise patient that drug works best when used after meals and at bedtime.
